page.title: 07The Winchmore Hill Store.
page.content: This is an account of a shop,and its {trade}in Winchmore Hill. Built in the 1930's,the shop has seen little change in either trade or appearance.Most of the customers are local,but there is some trade from people passing through.Trade has increased,however,since the new owners took over seven years ago. The shop is a general store and sells a wide range of goods,from food to soap powder,and provides for most of the villagers daily needs.Anything that the shop does not stock has to be purchased from larger stores in nearby large towns. The owners buy their stock in bulk from the Cash and Carry as well as supplies from sales. The shop was converted two years ago from counter service to self service to make shopping easier.
